page.title: 14Canals and their uses
page.content: The canals at Buckland are part of the Grand Union Canal. The Grand Union is the longest canal in Britain. Along the canal are lots of keen anglers. Also sometimes you get a lock. Locks are used for going down or up hill on a canal. Lots of anglers in Aston Clinton are members of Tring Anglers. They are a fishing organisation which lets you fish free once you have obtained your membership. Lots of anglers can differentiate between each fish they catch. The fish you find in the canal are Chubb, Tench and some Gudgeon. Tring Anglers say that after you catch the fish you must put them back to conserve the fish stock. The canal may be polluted in some places as somebody fell in and caught a disease which later killed the person.
